Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PxMor3 (P. xylostella Moricin 3, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (97.62%) toPx-MorA variant. G: 17%; V: 14%; A=N=R: 12%. GRAVY: -0.433; mol Wt: 4374.026; mol formula: C191H324N60O53; mol ex coeff: 1490.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 8.7 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (MIC 1107.5 ug/ml), S.marcescens (MIC 843 ug/ml), Gram+ S.aureus (MIC >1107.5 ug/ml), and B.cereus (MIC >1107.5 ug/ml).Structure:  it is random coiled in water and helical (81.9%) in 30 mM SDS.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET-32a(1) plasmid, expressed as a fusion with thioredoxin, His-tag purification, enterokinase cleaved.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: acted on membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Xia XF, Li Y, Yu XQ, Lin JH, Li SY, Li Q, You MS. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Cloning and functional identification of moricins from the diamondback moth, Plutella xylostella (L.).
